artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Maruya Jinpachi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 21; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 305.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: frowning, falling man wearing blue geometric patterned kimono, with bare legs, at center, being grabbed from behind by a man wearing a black and white garment with triangle patterns and a white headband, holding a sword in front of first man; another standing man wearing similar triangular patterned garment at left, holding a staff; battle scene in background in ULQ with silhouettes of fighting figures in the snow
markings: Artist’s seal: ヨし {Yoshi} | Censor seal: 申五改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Syllabary Copybook of the Treasury of Loyal Retainers (Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
text: Actors Kitaoka Nizaemon VIII as Ōboshi Yuranosuke (R) and Kō no Moronao (C), and Kataoka Gadō II as Ōboshi Rikiya (L). Related to the play Kanadehon Chūshingura 仮名手本忠臣蔵, performed at the Nakamura Theater in the 4th month of 1860.
title: Eleventh Act
